intro: Ceanothus cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban ceanothus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Cuba. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white or pale blue flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and dry forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
